title: Home
text:
I am a Year 1 student studying AAI1001 (Data Engineering and Visualization) in Applied Computing (Fintech). I enjoy learning how data moves from raw sources to clear stories and dashboards.



Interests: data cleaning, visualization, and simple automation
Current focus: building neat, readable dashboards for class projects
Goal: become confident at turning messy data into useful insights

title: Final Year Project
text:
This final year project is an e-commerce web application prototype. I used it to practice the full flow of an online store and to understand how different parts of a web app connect into one user journey.



Design a clear shopping flow from browsing to checkout
Organize product and order information in a structured way
Keep the interface simple and easy to navigate





Building a project end-to-end taught me how small design decisions affect the overall user experience.




thyeshan-ecommerce

title: Data Visualization
text:
This project visualizes a composite economic stress score for Singapore from 1993-12 to 2025-04. The score ranges from 0 to 100, with amber (40) and red (65) thresholds to signal elevated stress. Project repo: singapore-economic-stress-monitor.



Singapore Economic Stress Score time series with amber and red thresholds.





A monthly composite stress score (0-100) across more than 30 years
Amber and red thresholds to mark higher-risk regimes
A labeled latest value to make the current level easy to read




I created this visualization to summarize economic stress in one view instead of checking multiple indicators separately. The time series shows how stress moves through different periods, which makes it easier to spot spikes and calm stretches. Adding the shaded threshold bands helps non-technical readers interpret the score quickly. The callout on the latest value makes the chart useful as a quick status check.




Why a line chart: time is continuous, so a line best shows trend and volatility across months.
Why thresholds and shading: they provide a clear, visual reference for what counts as moderate vs. high stress.
Why annotation: highlighting the latest point directs attention to the most actionable value.

title: Data Visualization
text:
This chart summarizes the number of hours I spent on coursework each day during Week 6 of my first semester. I tracked the hours to understand when I was most productive and to avoid last-minute cramming.



Study hours by day

Bar chart of study hours from Monday to Sunday.  
 0  1  2  3  4
      
2.5 3.0 1.5 4.0 2.0 3.5 1.0
Mon Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat Sun
Hours Day of Week


Hours of study per day in Week 6.




Each bar represents total study hours for a day in the same week. The peak on Thursday shows my heaviest workday, while Sunday is the lightest.



I created this during an early module when I felt my schedule was uneven. The data helped me see that I was concentrating too much work mid-week. I used a bar chart because the days are discrete categories, and bars make it easy to compare values across categories without overcomplicating the message.

title: Reflection on the use of GenAI
text:
ChatGPT Codex



Improving content for my website
Give me ideas on what to write





GenAI has a large amount of knowledge on the subject matter
Makes it easier to brainstorm content





GenAI may not fully understand the context
Make people lazy to read and understand code




I might use GenAI in the future for brainstorming and creating frontend designs for websites.

title: Curriculum Highlights
text:
This page shares a few modules that shaped how I think about data and problem solving. I picked these because they were hands-on and gave me confidence to work with real datasets.



AAI1001 Data Engineering and Visualization: data cleaning, pipelines, and telling stories with charts
Programming Fundamentals: building logic with Python and testing small programs
Statistics for Data: interpreting distributions and making simple inferences




I built a small dashboard to compare weekly study time across modules. It helped me see which classes were taking the most effort and adjust my schedule.




SIT Academic Calendar
